New Records: Benin came from behind to win 2-1 against Libya in the CAF Qualifiers, marking a comeback victory for the team.
Key Match Events: Benin equalized the score with a great goal from Steve Mounié with a volley after a cross from the left flank.
Benin converted a penalty kick through Olaitan, giving his country the partial comeback goal.
Libya scored the first goal through Al Badri, converting the penalty kick.
Libya's goalkeeper Al Woheshi made several good saves to prevent Benin from scoring.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Mounié is the player to watch for Benin, with 17 goals and 3 assists in 51 games for his national team.
Ahmed Elmsmari is the most interesting player of the Libyan national team, playing for FC Barcelona B.
Libya has not played a match in their country for almost 7 years due to war and conflict.
Benin and Libya have a history of five meetings, with two wins for Benin and three for Libya.
Post-Match Reflections: Benin manager Gernot Rohr praised his team's comeback victory, saying they showed great character and determination.
The match was interrupted several times due to play being stopped on many occasions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Stade Félix Houphouët Boigny in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, with a capacity of 45,000 spectators.
The temperature in the stadium was around 82 degrees Celsius Fahrenheit.
Benin's lineup included Steve Mounié, while Libya's lineup included Ahmed Elmsmari.
